title: Ticket #3100: New ClassAd::Insert() doesn't handle attribute names properly
description: The new ClassAd method Insert(std::string&) doesn't handle attribute names properly. It takes a single string which should consist of an attribute name, a '=', and an expression. First, it assumes the only whitespace around the attribute name is a possible single space between the name and the '='. Second, it doesn't handle quoted attribute names at all. Quoted attribute names can contain a '=', fouling the method's search for the '=' that separates name and value. And quote attribute names need to be unquoted before being passed to Insert(const std::string& attrName, ClassAd *& expr, bool cache).
